items.headline: ‘He even bragged about his Mercedes-Benz:’ I rejected two egotistical advisers. I managed my life savings and they tripled over 25 years. Did I do OK?
items.summary_en: “We do not take out-of-country or five-star vacations. Instead, we enjoy time with family and friends and hobbies.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘We track our finances religiously’: Are we obliged to pay for our daughter’s medical school? We have $2.6 million saved for retirement.
items.summary_en: “I am retired, and my wife is an employed physician. She is 56 and would like to retire as well.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I’m at a crossroads’: I have $35K left on my mortgage at 3% interest. Do I dip into my $700K IRA to pay it off?
items.summary_en: “Over the last year, my two retirement accounts averaged a 15% gain.”

items.headline: ‘I have no mortgage’: Is it reckless to cancel my homeowner’s insurance? I can’t justify $4K a year anymore.

items.headline: ‘I’m ready to walk away’: I have $400K in retirement savings and want to quit my job of 30 years. Can I do it?
items.summary_en: “I really, really hate my job. I do work from home, but I’m very burned out.”

items.headline: My wife, 74, collects survivor benefits on her first husband. Can she now claim on her own Social Security record?
items.summary_en: “My wife began receiving survivor benefits at age 60 from her deceased husband.”

items.headline: Are you too old to see a shrink? As loneliness soars among seniors, the question is more relevant than ever.

items.headline: The Social Security crisis could leave U.S. retirees worse off than those in poorer countries
